intro: Sullivania disjuncta, commonly known as the Florida rocknettle, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and distinctive, palmate leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer. Sullivania disjuncta is often found growing in rocky or sandy soils along the coastlines of Florida.
